result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrance J Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 2 days jail credit if probation is revoked

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrance J Ray

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received notice from probation officer that defendant has paid in full
To probation supervisor regarding unpaid court ordered financial obligations, copy to defendant.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tyrance J Ray in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State's Notice, Demand, and Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tyrance J Ray in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing waived.   Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered. Will be disposition next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with Atty Alme Boaz on warrant return.  Counsel advises the defendant was confused on court date with traffic cases set for 2/11.  Court reinstates signature bond w/all other conditions.  Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; continuing to waive timelimits.  Court orders matter adj to 3/3 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg in B2.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant

Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz in court.  Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  Upon defendant's failure to appear, court orders warrant to issue. Forfeit any bail.
Conditions set by court:  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.
Status conference on February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tyrance J Ray in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Counsel waives reading of felony complaint.State requests $7500 signature bond with conditions.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
